text: Awesome place. Delicious food and amazing service for under $10. You get a lot food for your buck as well. I love it here
This place has the best chicken teriyaki. Always fresh and the rice is perfection. Definitely a must have !!! Trust me you won't be disappointed
Yes it's great. Stop reading and order. Simple menu but everything Iv had is excellent . Best Teriayki chicken in Vegas hands down

I love this place!!!! I have been eating here for years. Friendly stuff , and alway great customer service. if you're looking for a quick fast lunch, great quality food, in a friendly atmosphere, give this place a shot.

Best teriyaki place in town and we've been coming here for years!  The owner and staff are always friendly and cook your food upon ordering...No old food sitting under heat lamps here! Everything is fresh and delicious;  never a bad meal here, not once. Our favorite is the #1 chicken teriyaki with brown rice and a side order of shrimp tempura. Cabbage and a small salad are included with a flavorful dressing.  If you're looking for a quick, delicious meal for lunch or dinner at a very reasonable price then this is your place!  You won't be disappointed!

I've been a regular for about 2 or 3 years and I've never been disappointed. I usually order the Combo Plate. I'm a fan of the Honey Chicken, Thai Chicken and Beef Teriyaki. SO Freakn delicious. It's serve with a side of salad in a sweet and slightly tangy sauce and cabbage salad (you gotta have something light to eat with the savory). 
The meats are packed with flavor and love that it sits and sort of seeps down the rice giving the rice a bit of the goodness! 

^u^

a.w.e.some food. when my friend/coworker brought it into to work for lunch, i was like w.t.f. "great food"; just today finally went to and grab a #4 to go and told them "that it would be better if they delivered and they guy say so, so.... but ask four customers as i was waiting for my #4 if they thought it would be better and they do better if they delivered and they all said yes. "so you guys need to deliver."

I had the beef teriyaki. It was delicious. The meat was soft and very flavorful. I like to eat the salad with my beef and rice. The rice to beef ratio was fantastic. I had beef in every bite I had rice. The chicken teriyaki is just great also.

I love this place! My *only* complaint is that they have some bomb kimchi, but they never have it available. Boo..... ;-) The owner did explain why though, his mom actually makes it at home so the supply isn't always in keeping with the demand.
This place is fantastic, great customer service and great food. Friendly staff and happy atmosphere. Would give it a 10 star but there's only five... Great job teriyaki house!

I come here at least 3 or 4 times a week and I LOVE it. I get my food within 5 minutes and  I'm on my way! Cashier is really friendly! 

The prices aren't too bad for how much good you get, ranges from $6-$9. I'm completely full once I leave and am completely satisfied. 

My FAVORITE place for oriental food

this by far has the best spicy teriyaki bowl in Las Vegas . You have to try the spicy Ti the chicken is marinated with a good chili sauce and comes with either brown rice or white rice. also comes with a delicious salad with a special dressing. i highly recommend this spot if you are a fan of the bowls.

I saw a Groupon Now deal in the area (it's near my job) and figured why not. The place was clean, the food good and well-priced, and the staff nice. I had the teriyaki chicken bowl with steamed rice. 

It's not as good as Teriyaki Madness, but it's hard to measure up to the best!!

Went here the other night with a buddy, have to say wasn't that impressed with the menu or selection, neither the atmosphere. I ordered the #3, which is the crispy honey chicken. We had to wait over 15 minutes for our food, the chicken was definitely not made in house, it was some something like Tyson any'tizers chicken, with honey sauce poured over it. It had a weird taste and I was left feeling a bit sick afterwords. The dish says it comes with a vegetable, but what it really comes with is cabbage slaw that I found to distasteful, it also came with a salad that had an unpleasant dressing over it. The atmosphere is not something special. Also, their rice cooker was dirty and looked like it needed a good cleaning. The employees there lacked personality and seemed to not enjoy what they are doing. Also the cook was on his phone while he was cooking which I find to be rude. Definitely will not be coming back here anytime soon.

What a delicious discovery during our stay in Vegas! The kids are picky eaters but enjoy teriyaki and after reading the Yelp reviews, we ventured in and was not disappointed! 

The chicken teriyaki kids' meal at $3.95 was just the right size (and money) for smaller appetites (not to mention cheaper and healthier than a happy meal). 

I ate the salmon teriyaki and it was cooked just right - still juicy and tender! They give you bottles of their teriyaki sauce and you can slather on as much as desired to fit your taste buds. 

Too bad this is only found in Vegas (no chains in CA) but we will visit again when we are back!

I've been here 3 times and so far I like this place.  The food comes out fast and is pretty good.  I recommend the teriyaki chicken and the noodle bowl with teriyaki chicken.  The noodle bowl was a lot bigger than I expected and also came with rice which is not normal for noodle dishes... but hey more food is not a bad thing.  Try it out and have a good time eating!
This place is awesome; Very fast, delicious food, and cheap. Best teriyaki in Vegas. For the teriyaki meal ours $6.39. Can't beat it!
Great food! Very reasonable prices and comfortable setting. No bells & whistles, just good food for a good price
Have been coming here for years. Chicken katsu and teriyaki chicken are my favorites. You can even buy a jar of their home made teriyaki sauce.

I've been eating at Teryaki House for over 5 years now. Finally decided to write a review... Sorry for the wait! 

This is the best teryaki house in town. 
Everything is cooked right then, all meat is prepared on the grill and the rice steamed same day. 
Everything tastes delicious. 

My favotites are the Chicken Teryaki (#1) and Beef Teryaki. The cabbage is another great add on. They use a special vinegar light dressing, it is so good. 
I usually ask fot double cabbage instead of one portion of cabbage and one portion of the other green salad. 

And the Teryaki sauce itself is the best in town. I tried  some other Teryaki places recently, and the main ingredient - the Teryaki sauce was bad there, either too sweet or they add an extra unuasual slice ot ingredient to it. But at Teryaki House, it's the right taste and is just perfect. 

I also love the fact that it's locally owned. The owner himself is working in the restaurant most of the time and is always very friendly and helpful. 

I highly recommend this restaurant to all my friends! Everyone, enjoy!

This place has good Teriyaki for a fast food place.  The staff has always been friendly and the food is good for the price.  The portions are large and they have kid friendly meals.  This is a good place for a quick Teriyaki fix!

This place has the best teriyaki chicken. I've been going here since God knows when. Its been a couple of years and the quality or quantity never changes. The teriyaki sauce is amazing. As far as price, I think its decent. For the money you pay, trust me, you will get your moneys worth and it will have you going back for more.

Great go to Teriyaki place. Owner is there every day which makes me feel comfortable. Food is great. Love the Thai chicken. Working close to here makes this place a great lunch spot at least 2 times a week or more!

I've been to Teriyaki House several times since its close to my house. It's affordable and the portion sizes are just right. It tastes good and it's great for lunch or dinner. 

I recommend the chicken teriyaki, chicken katsu, Thai chicken and the crispy chicken. If you're looking for a quick bite or just want a to-go order, then this place is for you

This is always my go-to place for when I'm in the mood for chicken teriyaki.

The best Japanese flavors! You might thought it's a small place to eat but when you try their menu you would definitely go back again, i love their Calamari! And the Two side Salad was mouth watering! One of my favorite place to eat!
This place is great for lunch!  They have an awesome lunch special every day and it's a lot of food for a great price. Awesome family owned and operated small business.  Check them out.

Stopped by here on the way from Vegas and I must say, the food here is great. The whole family enjoyed their sushi and everything was very well prepared. The service was great. The girl routinely checked on us and we thought her service was so impeccable we wanted to write a review for her. Can't remember her name but she was light skinned, with brunette hair. If you know who she is please thank her for her kindness!
Love this place. Here like 2-3 times a month. Never lets me down... Get three choices for $10.. Great price and plenty of food.
Not typical American teriyaki, taste like real Japanese food especially the teriyaki beef and pork.

My favorite terriyaki house. I've moved out of LV and cannot find a good substitute for this place in san diego. Came back and it's just as good as I remember. Owner is super chill and they definitely work hard to give u a great meal. Portions are generous so u really get ur moneys worth.

I'm a fan of this place. Quick fast service, same staff and friendly faces that greet you by name once they get to know you and you can totally see that with all their regular customers, fresh and made when ordered good quality food! 

I've been coming to Teriyaki House since I first moved to the Valley in 2003. Same management still to this day. And the quality of food has never changed over the years. 

Because of the location (business plaza next to subway and coffee bean on south end of Rainbow before you get to 215 and arroyo plaza) this plaza is packed during the office lunch hours... They do lots of to go orders and have lots of people in and out during lunch breaks, so their quick and speedy service is definitely a best plus and a great quality they have. 

The place is small, not restaurant size at all. But the quality of food and service is so constant I have a hard time not wanting to come back. 

I always go for the tempura combination bento box which includes 2shrimp tempuras onion ring potato sweet potato and broccoli tempura. Along with that is a salad with light soy sauce dressing, pickled shredded cabbage, bowl of rice and your choice of #1-7 meat choices. All comes out to $9.39 with tax. Can't beat the prices and I leave stuffed every time! I always either go with Katsu chicken or Thai chicken as my meat option. Food is not too salty and I love how it's fried when ordered. But it's nothing mind blowing. Similar to chicken or Chinese food at the mall. 

They offer lunch specials of the day for a little over $7 with tax, they have huge serving of noodle bowls and they cook to order which I find good quality in. 

So why only 3stars? Well, it's not mind blowing food first of all, it's great lunch option or even quick dinner option, but that's what it is... Good quick eats. Nothing date worthy unless it's casual business or hanging out quick eats option. #2 I've watched them clean up after people leave and not saying they don't clean up... Coz they do, but not matter how many times I come... The tables are always sticky. Its a pet peeve of mine sticky tables. #3 the decor of the place is plain jane. It's like it makes me wanna eat alone and like I been saying just grab a quick great quality meal by myself. But if someone asked me hey let's grab food... Teriyaki House would NOT come to mind coz it's just so simple, wouldn't want to waste time grubbing with a friend there. Does that make sense... 

But hey I'm still a fan and I will always be back for my tempura combo bento box but probably only by myself

I went to teriyaki house on a friend's recommendation and because it's right around the corner from my house.  :) u always gotta know the good eats around your neighborhood ya know?  :)

The line was LONG but it did move quick.  I got there right at the peak of their lunch rush.  Needless to say I did have to wait a bit for my food but it was well worth the wait.  :) 

The chicken was hot and the gyoza was crispy.  :) Rice with teriyaki sauce was delicious.  The lunch special came with 2 salads.  One normal iceberg salad with a soy sauce based dressing.  The other was a cabbage salad in a vinegar based dressing. Iceberg was iceberg.  :) But the cabbage was surprisingly refreshing even though the cabbage
 was crunchy.

You could totally tell this was a mom and pop place.  So cute.  There was this little old lady wiping tables and the owner taking the orders was great at staggering you so that u didn't wait as long for your food.  He would jump from taking orders to helping out his cooks by flipping the chicken on the grill.  Good timing on his part. :)

And if u like to see the action in the kitchen, you'll love this place since it's an open kitchen design. 

I will most definitely be back.  :)
quick service! And the food is fresh & yummy! Great affordable prices. Perfect for lunch.

Favorite place to get teriyaki chicken! The staff is always super nice and the food is guaranteed delicious! Called in an order for pick up and when I got there about two minutes later they had my food ready for me! Customer service is excellent
This is a great family owned restaurant. Their Thai Chicken is the best thing on the menu, I recommend it to anyone! It has just the right amount of kick with even bigger flavor!

I came here many years ago before came yelper and thankfully things in life that life that never change over time....It always great too support small business and Teriyaki House is the perfect example versus all the other teriyaki fast food chains. I will admit never been too Teriyaki Madness. Sure there are other ones out there. The thing I like about this place is like the flavor of the teriyaki sauce reminds me of chicken teriyaki bowl or box back home Hawaii style. I have had the teriyaki but on this visit decided too go with the thai chicken, Any of the spicy ones nothing too worry about it being spicy spicy but add depth flavor too the sauce. The menu is pretty straight forward nothing too big and all the choices box style with rice, salad, and cabbage salad. Also have some appetizers and the kim chee is usually good although this visit never had it. 

Thai chicken grilled just right nice moist and ample sauce not piece in the bunch! The salad I REALLY enjoy with the house dressing its like sesame base type dressing. I could take bottle home if they bottled it. The salad greens nice fresh not bruises on the leaves. The shredded cabbage not really big fan of but still nice compliment with everything else. 

The service is pretty fast got my food quick, they have fountain station so endless refills for soda, and they have television inside for entertainment. It not big of place, Not much comes too decor but still tranquil or peacefully atmosphere too it. The price not go wrong lunch  or dunner under ten dollars. If looking for quick inexpensive teriyaki experience this is the place too goo.
Amazing food in here guys! In house made kimchi,  amazing favors as soon as you step inside the restaurant! Good size-plates for less than you would expect! My favorite lunch place!

Food is good here and the staff are very friendly and helpful. I loved their Korean steak bbq and the kids liked their chicken teriyaki as well. The unlimited teriyaki sauce was definitely a big plus too! Will definitely come back here :)
My big girl status came in handy...food was great! Makes a big difference from other teriyaki fast food place!

One of my favorite teriyaki places ever ! Very casual and delicious. Im a frequent visitor for take out at least twice a month. Has its own unique and delicious flavors , unlike most cookie cutter teriyaki places you often visit. ! Service is friendly and speedy! Definitely recommend

Definitely a place worth going. Lots of food for a good price. The crispy chicken with spicy sauce is delicious. Very friendly staff that remembers you after you've been in a few times. If you dine in, they give you as much extra sauce as you want. They even clean up after you, just leave your stuff on the table once you're done. Food is prepared fairly quickly as well, which is always a plus in my book.

I have been going to this place for a decade and they have never disappointed me. The owner is always so freaking friendly and awesome. I have always (I guess I'm just not very adventurous) gotten the tempura/thai chicken combo and it is very yummy. The rice is perfectly cooked all the time and the teriyaki sauce (that is definitely worth buying a jar of) is the yummiest I've had. It has a nice spicy kick to it. My kids like the chicken katsu, which is breaded and has a sweeter flavor. I was really surprised at how good that one was. Ten years, never been disappointed. It is so worth checking out, if you're looking for good teriyaki and a much better (and locally owned) alternative to Panda Express.

Love this place.  I eat here several times a month.  My only complaint is the combos come with lettuce with a bit of dressing and cabbage with a bit of dressing.  That's it for vegetables.  Seems redundant.  They're also not great.  I usually waste both.  The meat and rice is always outstanding.   If I could get some actual veggies, broccoli or zucchini or carrots or anything, this place would be a 10 out of 10.

The amount and quality of food you get for the cost is ridiculous. Possibly the best tempura I've ever had. It's a little out of the way for tourists who stick to the strip but well worth going out of your way.

Had lunch their for the first time on Friday, I wasn't disappointed. 

I had the chicken teriyaki with veg and rice and thought it was awesome. The staff were very friendly, the food was quick and you can see your food being prepared. 

They have hot sauce and soy sauce that you can help yourself to and the place was really clean and tidy and lots of people also eating. 

I will definitely be back.
I'm here for the second time today, the kimchi is fresh, the chicken teryaki is great and hopefully the chicken katsu doesn't let me down. I will be a regular here.
Been here many times. Food and service is always great. The lunch special is always a hit.

I frequent this place with my work buddy at least a few times a month and I can't believe I've never reviewed it. Eating here never disappoints. Food has great flavor and there's always plenty of it. The manager or owner is always chipper, in a snarky sort of way. 

My favorite dishes are the chicken katsu, the bowls and of corse the teriyaki. Can't wait to visit again. I want to try the kimchi next time. Oh one more thing, the price for their lunch specials rivals many places in the area. They do get really busy around lunch time but the food comes out fast.

Looks like I found another solid Teriyaki joint!

Located off of Rainbow with Patrick as the nearest cross street, you can easily pass these guys if you are not looking hard enough. Once yo make your way in, you will see that there is about 8 tables with each having four chairs. 

I came in for lunch on a friday and man were they busy! As I am in line waiting to order I can understand why a lot of people come here to pick up their phone orders because most if not all of the tables were taken! Im glad somebody just got done eating as soon as I placed my order.

Looking at the menu, you can tell that it is easily understandable. As for any teriyaki place, especially one that I am trying for the first time, I always get some kind of Beef and Chicken Combo. Its always a bonus if you can get brown rice instead of white. Here you can do that but they charge you 85 cents for that substitution while some other places dont charge you at all.

So I order the #10 Beef and Chicken Combo Plate ($8.29). All their plates come with rice, garden salad, and vegetable. I gotta say that the chicken and beef was very good. It had a nice chargrilled taste about it and was tender. The salad had some kind of rice vinegar on it and I thought it could of used a bit more because halfway through I was just eating straight lettuce. The vegetable was some kind of cut up cabbage and I think it was pickled with a hint of ginger.

Service was friendly and as soon as your order is done cooking, they make sure to get your attention.

Some random info. Yes they take cards. You can always phone your order in, especially during those peak hours at lunch and dinner. If you're on a budget I suggest you try their different monday through friday lunch specials ($6.49) from 11 am to 2:30 pm. Hours are Monday through Saturday 11 am to 9 pm. Closed Sundays. Lastly, they have all the teriyaki and sriracha sauce you need on every table. Love the convenience.

Will definitley come back to try their other items for the plate I good was pretty good.

Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #167

I've been here for years and will continue to come! Best teriyaki in town! Absolutely love this place! I only hoped they had chicken breast as an option but still their dark meat is decent, great portions!i wished they would have other locations, as I can't come too often, is close from work but far away from home...

If I worked closer to here, they could easily take my money every day. Fast and easy Japanese food option; their salad is really basic though and I wish they had a few more meat/tempura options.Their prices are low enough thought that buying an extra tempura plate doesn't make me protest. They say they charge for extra teriyaki sauce, but I think you can easily get more sauce here for free if you just pour it yourself after picking up a to-go order. This place is super casual and a good option if you are scrambling for time in the area. Yogi's and Volcano Grille are a bit more filling, but this place does salmon a lot better (while Yogi's doesn't do it at all).

three and half, but  If I'm taking my mom to lunch at this place...four stars....because they have brown rice, Sukimono, and pretty good garden salad with their lunches.

I'm just bummed that this side of the city has three very good local style places, and I have to choose between them..    I hate choices when I'm hungry, but this little hole in the wall is priced lower than Rice Trax, and Island Flavors;  also it's much easier to find than the other two places.

I really like Teriyaki house, but  they don't serve Mac salad as a standard item.   Please make it as upgrade item if you have too.    

Most of their meats are very good, and waiting time is no longer than 8 minutes.   So if you're on the run, this place can be as good going to McDonald during lunch rush if you want something now.
Awesome food, good prices! I had the salmon - - it was fabulous! Moist, flavorful, all-around goodness! If you're looking for authentic local Asian food, go to Teriyaki House!
Best Chicken Teryaki i've ever had. I love this place. The staff is great, reliable, and consistent. I've tried other Teriyaki places on Sunday (closed here) and Teriyaki House wins all the time.

Was looking for some cheap eats while in las Vegas and ended up here. ... not a bad choice.  Tons of food, low prices and great service.  The tempura coating was a little heavier than what I am accustomed to but it wasn't bad at all.  All and all, I would come back. ..
My boyfriend and my friends we all come here. It's really the best place in Vegas for teriyaki. The owner and everyone that works there is so nice! We always come back.

Just got done working out with some friends and was about to go to tonkatsu kiyoshi but they were closed for an hour (4to5) so my friend decided to take us here. 

Service- really friendly. It seemed as if it was the owner and he greeted us like he knew us. 

The food was good. I got the deluxe combo (#11) and it was really filling. I was able to split it and eat some the next day. 
I got the crispy chicken, teriyaki beef, and crispy calamari.  The crispy chicken was good. It is a rolled up ball of chicken, battered, and deep fried. Even though it was deep fried it tasted pretty healthy. The teriyaki beef was very tasty. Wasn't too sweet, and soft, not chewy. The crispy calamari is a must. Basically calamari fried to perfection. Comes with a side of sauce, I think sweet and sour sauce. My friend ended up finishing it before I could box it up. 

Overall this place is good. If I'm in the area, I'll probably be back if not trying a new place.
Great food, Great prices -- if you love local island style food -- this is the place to go -- the owner greets everyone with much Aloha!

Always good and fresh. But last time we got burnt steak:( we always get good food just not last visit. I'm sure the worker knew it wasn't done right. You can see it. Or did they run out? I would have rather been told we are out then have received lack of meat. I would try them again because it only happened once. We were embarrassed to say something bc we are always greater kindly. This place has brown rice which is a plus. Chicken always fresh. And food is always good except for las time.

Every single time we go in no matter the time between visits we are remembered and treated like family. Customer service is great. Food is amazing! Never disappointed. Only place we go for teriyaki chicken.
Best teriyaki I've had since I moved from Seattle!! Definitely one of my favorite spots and love supporting this awesome small business!

My oh my. I have spent years looking for the best spicy chicken teriyaki in Las Vegas and I have found it. I ordered a combo which came with shrimp, beef, and chicken. The beef was tasty and the grilled shrimp were ok but the spicy chicken absolutely won me over. I learned from other reviews you tell the cashier you want your food spicy when you order. If you live in the westside of town you are lucky bastards since I live in the eastside of Vegas. Stop by this place when you get a chance you will not regret it.
Reminds me of a a joint in NYC. Friendly and down to earth owner! First time I've talked to random people in a restaurant.
This place has some good meat. The portions are pretty good, a lot more meat then i expected which is a good thing. The food is priced well and is a nice place to eat at.

Unlimited teriyaki sauce order various of combinations you have yourself a great lunch meal for before or after work. Brown rice best 
I like this place better than teriyaki madness the employees are very welcoming . Place is super clean . for the price  the quality of food is too good to pass up
I've been coming here for a few years now and still think it's the best teriyaki place in the area. The food is good and the customer service isn't bad either.

My new favorite place!!! I've been here twice and it never disappoints. At Japanese restaurants, I either get All You Can Eat sushi or salmon teriyaki. I've never really tried other places that are more "on the go" rather than a sit down restaurant. I always thought their salmon teriyaki may not be as good. 

But, boy was I wrong! Teriyaki House is amazing. When I have a favorite, I typically only order it every time for the rest of eternity. I could eat their salmon teriyaki everyday if I could. But, that's not even the best part. The best part: their teriyaki sauce. Oh my... You might as well call my salmon teriyaki "salmon teriyaki soup" because of how much sauce I put in it. Their salmon comes perfectly and does not need any flavoring, but the sauce is just so dang good, I can't help myself. 

Not only does Teriyaki House serve delicious food, their staff is also the most welcoming and sweetest I've encountered. Their owner is also a really nice guy. It's always great to meet the owners of great places and to see how much they love being there.

4 stars cause the food was delicious. But 3 stars for the cleanliness. 

I got the salmon Teryaki to go and the portion size was great for the price. You don't get these type of servings in a lot of sushi or Teryaki places. Well from what I have been to. My coleslaw seemed like it's been old. It was really dry and the texture seemed like it's been sitting in the fridge for about a few days. I also didn't receive any almonds on top of that. The size of my teryaki sauce was pretty small for the size of my salmon. Deceiving pictures, lol. Then when I opened my salad, there was a hair which made me lose my appetite on digging in that salad of mines...
Love the beef teriyaki and the honey chicken. Hasn't always been consistent but the food is always good and the owner is super nice.
I have been coming here for over 8 years, the food is amazing and the customer service is off the charts. Very rare you get to interact with the owner which is a nice touch.

Another great lunch spot close to my work! The gentleman (possible owner/manager)that is always working the register is very friendly and personable.  The teriyaki beef lunch special is great, portions not too big, not too small...just right. For the price the quality of food is great and cooked to order so you know you always get a fresh piping hot meal instead of something that has been sitting under a heat lamp forever.Great place to grab a quick bite to eat at a very affordable price. Only complaint is there is a healthy upcharge for brown rice instead of white rice.....and it just makes me upset because it is delicious and i have to get the brown rice every time.

Been going here for a couple of years now and just love their weekly special plates for just $6.49. The teriyaki chicken always delivers on taste and freshness and the gyoza, chicken katsu or crispy chicken are all tasty additions and the tangy cabbage salad is also a great companion. My favorite teriyaki place that I've found in this town in 8 years here.

And not only is the food great but the owner is a really cool guy too.

Check it out.

First time here at Teriyaki House... & it won't be the last! You honestly can't go wrong with chicken teriyaki, gyoza(potstickers), Asian slaw, side salad AND rice bento for $7.49 from open to 2:30pm on special. It was soooo good, homemade not generic tasting like teriyaki madness. I ordered a side of shrimp tempura, bc why not! Food was so fresh, & so flavorful.
Found this place through yelp. Lives up to the great reviews. Friendly with good food! I'll be coming back a lot.

Having just relocated from Gardena/Torrance in California to Las Vegas, I have been immensely craving Japanese-Hawaiian food. I think I may have found a good new dig to kill any future cravings for such food!

Teriyaki House is great food! I ordered their Deluxe Combo for $8.99 and chose: 
teriyaki chicken
chicken katsu
teriyaki beef
+side of kimchi

I was super surprised when I was handed my to-go order because it was so heavy! When I got to work and opened it up, I discovered enough food for lunch today AND tomorrow, on top of the fact that the food was absolutely delicious!

If you are craving some Hawaiian-Japanese food and are somewhere near the Southwest part of town here in Vegas, DEFINITELY come in here and give it a try!

Would I recommend to others? You betchya.
Would I come back here? Already trying to decide which day I want to come back next week!

Wow what can I say about this place that hasn't been said already. This place has probably become one of my favorite teriyaki places yet. As soon as you walk in the door the aroma of the food is amazing. They have so much to choose from which options to please everyone. They teriyaki sauce is the bomb. Homemade by the owner it's awesome. You can also buy jars of it for $5 bucks which I always do. I have tried several things the beef teriyaki, chicken teriyaki, an the salmon teriyaki an they are all very very good. The salmon if you like fish is a must try. It's all made fresh to order with white rice an salad. I like the fact that the sauce is on the side so you can put it on when you get home. The service is spot on an they are very fast about getting your order out. I highly recommend you stop by an give them a try. Their prices are very affordable an you get so much food for the price. So head on over an try them. You won't be disappointed.

Great food! Always fresh and consistent. 
I've been coming for over 5yrs and I cannot seem to find a place that compares. Kye the owner is a trip always with a great attitude! 

Great customer service. Great food! What else can we ask for!?

Have to agree with the other reviews. . . it's good, and I've been there several times, but not something I rave about to my friends or go out of my way for. I usually get the spicy beef or chicken noodle. Big portions, nice flavor and decent pricing.

First time trying it.  I work across the street. I was really thinking of going to subway but this place caught my eye. Ill def be back. Noddles nice and soft plus it comes with rice veggies and and the chicken is amazing.  Thanks guys ill be back soon.

Teriyaki Salmon is my new thing.  Trying to get more of that omega-3 action into my diet.  Since my previous review i've been here just about every day.  Trying to convince myself i'm eating healthier and better.

sidenote:  Close on Sunday.

Fast, generous portions and delicious!  I'm here on business and wishing this place existed where I live. Instead of the usual bowl, the teriyaki is served bento box style, with an Asian salad and chopped cabbage. It makes for a hearty meal and is very inexpensive as well. Sure beats the usual burger and fries when searching for fast food. I think I'll be visiting this place whenever I'm in town.
Teriyaki house is the KING of teriyaki. This place gives you the absolute best portion and quality for your money. I will never go to a different teriyaki restaurant.. EVERRRRRR

Super yummy and excellent portions and service! As soon as we entered we were greeted and made to feel welcome. The chicken noodle bowl was awesome and they give you enough for a giant! New fave teryaki spot for sure!!

Had the beef teriyaki. Decent amount of food, prepared well. They serve in a bento box--meal included teriyaki, white rice (in separate compartments), salad, and a sunomono-style slaw. Thought it was kind of odd to get two salads. Good over all, but kind of out of the way for me.

I take most Asian people would not say this place is good, because it's obviously just Asian food, that's it. Not even close to write what it is good and what it is has to be improved. Okay, so any American wanna try Asian food go find some proper typical Asian restaurant instead of some fake Asian food... Just put normally cooked chicken and vegetable.. Oh right.. Plus..."RICE", and you call"wow, I love Asian food." If you ever really try some good ones in town, you would say"oh I'm in heaven". You know, my mom would feel sad for me if I had this terrible Chinese or Japanese food... Because she cooks way better... And mom, don't be sad, we actually got some decent Chinese food here. :)

Delicious food at an affordable price. Food is fresh and served up quickly. I've never had a bad meal here, they are always consistant. I usually order the Thai Chicken, sooo good! :)  Other items I've tried and like:  Beef Teriyaki, Chicken Katsu & Honey Chicken. The owner, Kai is from Hawaii and super friendly.  His two cooks are also really nice.

This place is pretty solid. I love the whole bento box type meal. The meat is juicy, and the slaw adds a nice crunch along with the meat. Lots of different meal choices. Also, the guy up front (the owner?) is pretty funny. I like going to places with people like that.

I just started working in the area a few weeks ago & getting familiar with lunch places. Headed to Panda xpress & looked up & saw this place. I immediately turned around & I'm glad I did. When I walked in you could see the chefs cooking the food fresh....not out of bags. I ordered a spicy chicken noodle bowl which was a little under $10 but enough for 2 people. It was soooo good & did I say FRESH.  Definitely going back.

Came to this place on a whim. I'm glad I did! The Teriyaki House has a pretty extensive menu!  Since this is my first time here I ordered the chicken katsu and teriyaki pork. My safety order if you will. I decided to dine in, and get a feel for the atmosphere here, and it's calm and a nice typical little place to grab some lunch. The food comes out in a bento box style which to my surprise was pleasant to see. Meat was in one spacing, rice,and two helpings of veggies(one salad and the other a vinegar coleslaw). Everything was delicious. And to top it all off, the place is family owned! Which I admire and truly like even more. The owner or manager greeted me with a sense of humor that caught me off guard but had fun intentions,so I played along. He has his son's art work displayed on the wall, and they are great to look at. This place is in a nice spot too, right on rainbow's main street. I would definitely come here again! Good food,good vibes and Family owned. All great qualities!

A place close to my friends work where I can just pick up some Spicy Noodles and Tempura Shrimp when I'm In the mood. Nothing fancy here.
Closed on Sundays!

So I ordered the spicy teriyaki lunch special...  The food was ok.  However, as I was waiting, I noticed it was time to make more rice in the cooker.  The cashier brought out a bag of rice and then a container full of water.  He poured the water in the cooker but then what happened next was a little disturbing.  He took the water container and put dirty dishes in it!  I would really like to believe the container was clean with the rice water.  I just don't agree using a bus container with anything that touches clean food.......  Did I eat the rice????  NOPE.

Great food, great value, served by the nicest guys. I've become a regular in a short amount of time.

Their teriyaki sauce is excellent. Their portions are generous, even the salmon. I especially like that the deluxe combo gives you 3 choices so you can sample a variety.

The meals come with cabbage and green salad side, both are a really great palate cleanser between each delicious bite of teriyaki goodness.
A place i found by accident and will return. The guy taking orders has a personality similar to the "no soup for you" guy with a twist.  Prices reasonable.

i can sum up my experience eating  the food at teriyaki house with two simple words....ba bang!!!
food was amazingly delish! service outstanding!
thank you

Went in for lunch..menu prices were outdated on Yelp. Ordered 2 salmon teriyaki, asked for 1 medium rare,was told no..as I was changing 1 order of salmon I was swoosh (hand gesture to get out the store by the lady in front. She proceeded to tell me the salmon was already dropped, in which the man on the grill dropped nothing..he was cleaning one side of  it with chix on the other side. The lady said that we were difficult. Had no idea asking for salmon not well done was difficult. I work in the restaurant industry and understand that there's a risk for ordering food rare and medium rare ...if a customer wants it,I make it anyway.  Would have loved to try this place yet management wouldn't allow me too...still not understanding Why? ...Oh well,plenty of other great restaurants in the valley,their lost for swooshing money away (they do have the right to refuse anyone).

Came in for lunch, place looks nice and clean and has a very simple menu about 20 things to order with the variation being mainly meat choice and noodles or rice. 
We ordered the crispy chicken, Thai chicken, tempura, and deluxe combo plate with honey chicken beef teriyaki and calamari. 
The crispy chicken was a bit big and kind of hard to eat especially for our 6 year old you can't really but into them easily so you just kind of stuff a whole want and your mouth and hope you don't die.  Flavor was okay nothing really special here. 
The tempura was really good and tasted fresh and just right. 
The Thai chicken was really good as my partner said but I wasn't too impressed with it or the honey chicken I had in my order. 
The teriyaki beef was kind of disappointing and really chewy I wouldn't get it again and a very similiar experience with the calamari. Just not really a fan of the food here but the service was quick and friendly. If you go get the shrimp tempura.
And a side note it's pretty disappointing that the boxes pretty much come with two salads.

The prices are hella great here and the taste of the food is on point. I was hesitant to really try this place just because it seemed like the same style of food that was junk at some other spot I have eaten at previously. There is no need to worry with this place though as the food is good and the sauces we got with the crispy chicken was different in a good way.

We will definitely be coming back here again and trying more things.

Pretty good teriyaki plus their kids Bowl for the kiddos are huge as well.
It's a perfect place for lunch and quick eats dinner.
The two guys working there were super nice and very friendly to our kids.
Definitely recommend this place if you r looking for teriyaki plates.

I'll have to go with the congregation here....there's nothing overtly badass about this place that would make me rate it higher. Selection is good....I stop by and support whenever I'm on this side of town but I don't go out of my way. 

I lolz-ed at the other reviewers' mentioning the interesting things on the plasma TVs...I was getting takeout one evening a couple months ago and it was Dirty Jobs with good ol' Mike Rowe. It was hilarious watching people trying to avoid looking up at the geoduck farming and seafood factory processing while they were hunched over their bento boxes. I think the owner noticed this and switched the channel....to a medical procedure on Lifetime. You can't make this stuff up, people. Get the calamari/spicy chicken with the extra hot red sauce....it'll leave a mark.
Seriously the best..... Owner is hilarious. Food is delicious. Only Terriyaki place I eat at!

Perfect location for me since it's right down the street from my house. I always order the salmon teriyaki w/ brown rice. It also comes with a salad and some shredded cabbage. I love their signature teriyaki sauce too. At least, I think it's teriyaki sauce. lol  It's good and that's all that matters. Costs me around $8 something for that.
Little pricier than most of the plates (ranging from $6-7) but still okay price overall.

Check this place out!

I was in the mood for some rice and meat and my friends told me to try this place. I walked in and thought it was pretty neat inside given the small location size. I ordered Thai chicken bowl to go as I was heading to work for the evening. The food was prepared quickly and it smelled AMAZING!! I got to work and the entire office began smelling like my meal. I had co workers from down the hall asking what I had so I'm sure there were a few who stopped by to grab a bite. 

The rice was cooked to perfection and the chicken was so flavorful. I liked the addition of the cabbage as a salad on the side, made for a balanced meal.
Overall I was pleasantly surprised with the whole experience and am looking forward to trying other items on the menu to fill my Asian palate needs.

I actually went to this when it opened. Teri just beat me to reviewing...GRRRRR. Ok the teriyaki is good. It's not...OH MY GOD MY MOUTH IS CONVULSING INTO ORGASMIC PLEASURE. But it's decent. It's not the greatest. It's a teriyaki place. Really....not hard too screw up. The spicey chicken....eh...not so spicey. Definitely not Teriyaki Madness. which I crave spicey chicken. The Teriyaki chicken and beef....eh. It's teriyaki chicken and beef. The seafood noodles...pretty good. Veggie noodles...pretty good too. I just think it's cool that you can get stuff spicey. Hehehe when this first opened. I used a ninja remote(a mini universal remote on my keychain) to change channels and raise the volume on their plasma tvs....MWahahaha it was funny!

Teriyaki House is a family owned fast casual restaurant in Southwest LV. You can get all kinds of teriyaki from chicken to salmon, and more. I love that everything is made to order so everything is fresh. I also love the bento box set-up that you're getting more than just rice with your meal. Who doesn't love some fresh veggies on a hot summer day in Vegas? 

The owner is super personable and friendly - making you want to return ASAP!

I consider myself somewhat of a Teriyaki chicken connoisseur . Teriyaki House is possibly the best Teriyaki I've ever had; definitely the best in Vegas. The chicken has a smoky BBQ flavor and is cooked perfectly every time. 

The owner/manager is a super chill dude who handles his business well. I love the efficiency that he runs his business with. This place is highly recommended to any Teriyaki chicken lover who loves a good value as well!

I guess it's about time I reviewed my favorite Lunch spot! I kinda just accidentally ran into this place...I was driving around during my lunch hour, saw this place and said "Mmmm Teriyaki" in my most Homer Simpson voice possible. 
     It's a small spot but with a decent amount of strategically placed seating. They have a Lunch Special for every day of the week my favorites are Monday's - Teriyaki Chicken and Gyoza. The lunch specials come with a half/half entree, rice, slaw (sounds gross but it's soooo good!) and a side salad. All of that for under $7!! The portions are ginormous so you definitely won't go hungry! I usually have enough food to save for the following day! 
   It has an open kitchen so you can watch them cook the meats...it's pretty neat actually. Everyone here is awesome! It feels like home whenever I come here! Lol! Call ahead for your lunch if you're taking out! They usually get packed at the lunch hour bit the food is usually ready within 10mins! 
     Fast.Friendly.Delicious.Affordable.

This place is just ok. I thought the chicken was dry. I tried 3 different kinds and they were all dry. I think the sides could be improved. Rather than two iceberg lettuce salads,a potato or mac salad would be a nice addition. The prices are good though!

Calling themselves the "Best Teriyaki in Town," the Teriyaki House has a lot to live up to.  You can even purchase a jar of their special concoction.    

I came across this new restaurant on a weekday for lunch.  It's more fast food than full service, which is great if you're on a lunch run from work.  Opting for their Tempura Plate ($6.99), which included two pieces each of shrimp, potato, onion, broccoli, and carrot. It also comes with rice, side salad and pickled cabbage.  It was a decent amount of tempura, but being the dipper that I am, I could have used a bit more sauce.

The BF arrived before me and ordered the Spicy Chicken ($5.79), which is deep fried chicken in a spicy sauce.  He told me not to order it and after tasting it, I could see why.  The batter was a bit too thick for these chicken pieces.

Another friend ordered the Calamari with Sauce Plate, which was deep fried calamari pieces with a spicy sauce similar to the one the Spicy Chicken came with.  It, too, was just okay.  

They also serve up pan fried noodle dishes from $5.50 to $6.95 that comes with mixed vegetables and a side of rice.  Side orders include gyozas, spring rolls, miso soup, and kim chee.  You can take advantage of their Daily Lunch Special from Mondays through Fridays (11 am to 2:30 pm) that are $5.95 and could be Chicken Teriyaki and Gyozas (Mondays) or Chicken Teriyaki and Chicken Katsu (Wednesdays).

Overall, Teriyaki House is an average place to go.  There's nothing particular "Best of" here for me, but it'll do for lunch.
Love this place, great people, food is always good. The shop isn't the most visually pleasing, but the employees are nice and the service is great!

Best teriyaki chicken I've ever had! I ordered the spicy teriyaki and asked to substitute the two salads for extra rice. The sauce was the perfect consistency, not too runny but not too sticky either. The rice was delicious with the extra teriyaki sauce they provide on the side for to go orders. I also really liked their chicken. A lot of teriyaki places I've gone to will have decent sauce but with the fattiest, most  rubbery chicken ever. Teriyaki House's chicken was perfectly cooked and with no stringy fat or odd chewy pieces. I'll definitely be returning for more.

The owner Kai is super friendly, from Hawaii just like me and full of Aloha! The food is sooooooo good! I walk in and Kai always knows what I want to eat. Everything is made fresh to order and delicious. I highly recommend!

I already had the mentality that this place was just gonna be average.  Walking inside, the menu is right smack in front of you above the cash register.  The pictures help when ordering because most of the time my appetite comes from my eyes.  I liked the concept of the food being served in bento boxes since that gives a Japanese feel.

As I got to the cashier, he didn't seem to be very eager to take my order.  I think when I asked questions, he seemed more annoyed than anything.  After I told him I would eat there, I quickly changed my mind and said to go.  He let a big sigh out as if to make it know how annoyed he was.  I decided to order the 3 combo with squid, thai chicken, and beef teriyaki.  it comes with rice, cabbage salad, and just your regular house salad with lettuce and carrots.  They don't deliver your food to your table, they call it out to you and you have to go back to the front to get the food.  It was as I expected, just your ordinary teriyaki joint with the ordinary taste of a teriyaki joint.  Still, I liked it and would go back.  The portion was very big so I was able to the rest for dinner.

On my way out, the same cashier said thank you but didn't even look at me.  I guess it's just a force of habit to say thank you and not mean it.  What ever tho.  I'd still go back just coz food is convenient.

I love coming here for lunch. They have a vast selection, so I never get tired of eating here. Food is quick to be served and very inexpensive. The daily lunch deals are awesome! The calamari is fantastic- it's big pieces of perfectly cooked squid. That and the spicy crispy chicken are my two favorite entrees. 

If you haven't tried the food here yet, I highly recommend it.
Great place to eat and inexpensive.  Owner is always really nice and food comes quickly.

Great tasting food, friendly service, and large portions make my surprise stop at Teriyaki House a happy one.  I wasn't planning on eating dinner here, but work had other ideas as I found myself rather hungry while I was in the southwestern part of town.  The restaurant didn't disappoint and I've already recommended it to my friends.
My favorite. Every Time I go here is why I go here! Dont let the other Teriyaki clowns fool you! Teriyaki House is the bomb!
Just stopped by to pick up a quick lunch. And talk about quick. I placed an order while I was on my way there and literally in 4mins my food was ready. Service was kinda short but the guy was cool.

He best thing was the price. Compared to Volcano Grille and Teriyaki madness this place was pretty good. Didn't like the up charge for brown rice (.85), thought that was kind of steep. Veggies on the side were kind of redundant.  Cabbage and then lettuce - green/green.  Would be better if it was mix veggies and something else but oh well.

So good.  I always get a combo with honey chicken. This place is always busy.  Service is quick. Food is yummy. The dining room, tables, chairs, tables, door, etc all need a good scrubbing. The kitchen looks clean and I see good practices when I watch the kitchen. It is open concept so you can watch the cooks prep your food. There is a tv and it is kid friendly. It's not a big dining area. The owner talks with everyone and is very welcoming.
Got the combo plate with Thai chicken and teriyaki chicken. Both meats were great and I like the salad they give you as well.
Perfect not too sweet and also it's not too heavy but good portion. Very welcoming and friendly.

Better than average food at this strip mall take-out teriyaki spot. 

The lunch specials, available until 2:30 weekdays, are a ton of food. $6.49 got me teriyaki chicken, four gyoza dumplings, rice, a garden salad (iceberg and carrots in a soy vinaigrette) and perhaps the most pleasant surprise of all, the cabbage slaw, which made a very nice alternative to the usually soggy, pale stir-fried veggies most teriyaki places include in their plates. The brown rice upgrade was 85 well-spent cents.

HUGE PORTIONS for about $7?! You gotta visit this place for your next lunch break! 

My friends and I came here for lunch one day and we were blown away at how cheap the price was and for the amount of food you get! Two of our guy friends went with the beef teriyaki bento box and us girls decided to go with the vegetarian noodle bowl and the chicken teriyaki noodle bowl. Literally we could not finish our food and had to take home leftovers! The noodle bowls come with your choice of meat and a side of rice so you can definitely get full really fast lol. 

Food was pretty good and everyone really enjoyed their meal. My vegetarian bowl had a lot of flavor in it and was really filling thanks to the rice that was added in.

Service was really quick too which was great for we were on a lunch break. Definitely recommend this place to get a cheap but delicious meal!

I always enjoy the lunch specials which change daily for less than $7. The staff here is excellent, honest and hospitable. Food is served made to order promptly. Definitely check this place out if your in the mood for some terriyaki.

We got a teriyaki chicken plate and a Thai chicken plate. Both proteins were tasty but the Thai took the cake as far as a good balance of spice and sweet. 

The "plate" is sort of a misnomer here because the food most definitely comes in a bento box. 

Along with the meat and rice comes a salad with a light, maybe peanut dressing. I honestly couldn't tell what it tasted like because it was mostly just lettuce. There's also some cabbage that was a little sweet, think cole slaw, but not utterly saturated in sauce. 

I really did like the meat but for me the veggies just didn't cut it. I would have preferred some nice steamed veggies other than two salads.

I love this place and go here at least once a week for lunch. Their lunch specials are a great value and the food is always delicious. Their quality doesn't seem to waiver at all. The guy who runs the place is unique and makes you feel welcome as long as you're not the sensitive type. I'm never disappointed when I go here.

This is my favorite teriyaki shop in Vegas. I always get #1 for me and my toddler boy. The chicken is super fresh and always perfectly grilled and seasoned. You get pickled salad and lettuce salad to go with your choice of teriyaki goodness and white or brown rice. Kye and his team are the best, super friendly and really know sports lol. Well, lemme just say... my son Owen is a super picky eater and knows his stuff. He always will ask for Uncle Kye's teriyaki. Check out the picture for proof!!!
This is one of Vegas' hidden gems. The teriyaki chicken is delicious and aggressively priced. Me and one of my best friends (shout out Joel L.!) Come here often for the lunch special

Teriyaki House is a great spot! I always get the tempura combo with thai chicken - it's got a little spice to it and is GREAT on rice! For $8.69 (plus tax) you get ~8 pieces of tempura, including 2 shrimp and assorted veggies, plus rice, salad, and the chicken. Food is prepared so quickly even though there are usually only 1 or 2 employees working, one of which is obviously the owner (who is also really nice). Delicious food for a great price makes this restaurant one of our go-to favorites. There are daily lunch specials for $6.49 which usually include their basic teriyaki chicken. The honey chicken is great too! Highly recommend!
The owner here is awesome comes out and talk story with the customers food here is great ...!!!!

Tried it for the first time today. Called in an order for a lunch special. Picked it up 15 minutes later. No problems. It was SO good, and really affordable and a good deal for the amount of food you get. Will definitely be going back.
3 days straight. Can't get enough! Just the way I like my katsu. Mmmm sooooooo goooood :)

If your looking to satisfy your hunger, give Teriyaki House a visit. They have a friendly staff with great menu selection with reasonable prices that is sure to leave you happy and content. 

Today, I had the teriyaki chicken/chicken katsu special and it hit the spot. They have a chicken katsu sauce was was light and tasty but truthfully, no sauce was needed as it had great flavor on its own. I also sampled the shrimp tempura and the light crispy texture of the batter was perfect with its tasty tempura sauce.  And lastly, the gyoza makes an excellent addition to anything you order as the sauce is also light and tasty as well.
